properties.name: value
properties.doc: Bound to the selected scenario.

properties.name: show_add_button
properties.doc:
If True, the button to create a new scenario is visible.
If False, the button is not displayed.

properties.name: display_cycles
properties.doc:
If True, the cycles are show in the tree view.
If False, the cycles are not shown.

properties.name: show_primary_flag
properties.doc:
If True, the primary scenarios are identified by a specific visual identifier in the tree view.
If False, all the scenarios are shown identically.

properties.name: on_change
properties.doc:
The name of a function that is triggered when the value is updated.
The parameters of that function are all optional:
  • state (State^): the state instance.
  • var_name (str): the variable name.
  • value (Scenario): the selected Scenario.

properties.name: height
properties.doc: The maximum height (in CSS unit) of the tree.

properties.name: scenario
properties.doc: The scenario to display/edit.

properties.name: active
properties.doc:
Indicates if this component is active.
An inactive component allows no user interaction.

properties.name: expandable
properties.doc:
If True, the scenario visualizer can be expanded.
If False, the scenario visualizer is collapsed and only its name an submit button are visible.

properties.name: expanded
properties.doc:
If True, the scenario visualizer is expanded, and its content is displayed.
If False, the scenario visualizer is collapsed and only its name an submit button are visible.

properties.name: show_submit
properties.doc:
If True, the scenario submit button is shown.
If False, it is not visible.

properties.name: show_delete
properties.doc:
If True, the scenario delete button is shown.
If False, it is not visible.

properties.name: show_config
properties.doc:
If True, the scenario config label is shown.
If False, it is not visible.

properties.name: show_cycle
properties.doc:
If True, the scenario cycle label is shown.
If False, it is not visible.

properties.name: show_tags
properties.doc:
If True, the scenario tags are visible/editable.
If False, they are not visible.

properties.name: show_properties
properties.doc:
If True, the scenario properties are visible/editable.
If False, they are not visible.

properties.name: show_pipelines
properties.doc:
If True, the scenario pipelines are visible/editable.
If False, they are not visible.

properties.name: show_submit_pipelines
properties.doc:
If True, the scenario pipelines submit button are visible/editable.
If False, they are not visible.

properties.name: scenario
properties.doc: The scenario to display.

properties.name: render
properties.doc: If True, this scenario DAG is visible on the page.

properties.name: show_toolbar
properties.doc:
If True, the DAG toolbar is visible.
If False, it is not shown.

properties.name: height
properties.doc: The maximum height (in CSS unit) of the DAG.

properties.name: width
properties.doc: The maximum width (in CSS unit) of the DAG.

properties.name: value
properties.doc: Bound to the selected datanode.

properties.name: display_cycles
properties.doc:
If True, the cycles are show in the tree view.
If False, the cycles are not shown.

properties.name: show_primary_flag
properties.doc:
If True, the primary scenarios are identified by a specific visual identifier in the tree view.
If False, all the scenarios are shown identically.

properties.name: on_change
properties.doc:
The name of a function that is triggered when the selection is updated.
The parameters of that function are all optional:
  • state (State^): the state instance.
  • var_name (str): the variable name.
  • value (DataNode): the selected Datanode.

properties.name: height
properties.doc: The maximum height (in CSS unit) of the tree.

properties.name: id
properties.doc: The identifier that will be assigned to the rendered HTML component.

properties.name: class_name
properties.doc:
The list of CSS class names that will be associated with the generated HTML Element.
These class names will be added to the default taipy_gui_core-<element_type>.
